title: RF Passive Design Engineer
summary: Do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? Do you like changing the game? Envision what you could do here! At Apple, we believe new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. We are looking to hire a Chip Passive Design Engineer in a group at Apple that develops RF chips that will be used in Apple mobile devices. You will be responsible for on chip inductors / transformers/ caps/ transmission lines, as well as on chip filters, phase shifters, and couplers etc. You will orchestrate the process from design to tape-out and work closely with multi-functional teams including RF design team, packaging design team, CAD, process teams etc.
description: -  Electrical and Physical design of EM/Microwave components and circuits. -  Working with RF/packaging/CAD/Process engineering multi-functional teams to architect and develop future RF on chip passives.
key_qualifications: Demonstrates deep knowledge on electromagnetic theory, microwave engineering and antenna engineering. Proficiency with EM passive designs and familiarity with EM simulation tools like HFSS, Peakview, EMX, Momentum or Helic. Experience on chip EM modeling is helpful.Familiar with on-wafer measurement, have experience using VNA, TDR, LCR meters etc. Excellent academic background with industry related work experience beyond graduate school studies.
education_experience: BS and 3+ years' of relevant industry experience.
